page.title: 17The Railway Line.
page.content: The railway that passes through our block is a section of line originally built in 1847 to link the north with the south of England by a shorter route. It was constructed by the Trent Valley Railway Company. The Company built the line between Stafford and Rugby. The London and North Western Railway Company took over the running of the line and in 1904 it was doubled in size to four tracks. The crossing in Bishton Lane was then replaced by a bridge but the crossing keeper's cottage is still nearby. In 1924 the London Midland and Scottish Railway Company took over and in 1948 it became part of the London Midland Region of British Railways. This line has seen the changes of locomotives from steam to diesel to electric traction including twice weekly runs by the Advanced Passenger Train.
